stimulusHtml: A block slides to the right across a rough horizontal surface. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the mechanical energy of the block-Earth system decreases or stays the same as the block slides, and provides a valid justification?
choicesHtml: The mechanical energy decreases because energy is dissipated by the external force of friction.
The mechanical energy decreases because kinetic energy is converted to gravitational potential energy.
The mechanical energy remains constant because the block remains at the same vertical position throughout.
The mechanical energy remains constant because energy is always conserved.
